scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. Previously, when one of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time,' you responded by encouraging the team to stay focused and work together. During a team meeting, [Monica] slammed her pen on the table and added, 'Even if we try our best, there's no way we can meet this deadline.' [Bob] nodded in agreement, looking equally concerned. You suggested taking a pause to rethink the approach. Now, with the team gathered again, [Monica] leans back in her chair, crossing her arms, and says, 'So, what’s the new grand plan?'
scenes.description: Monica's skepticism is evident, and Bob looks at you expectantly.

options.text: Let's brainstorm some ideas together. We need everyone's input to come up with a viable plan.
options.analysis: You invited collaborative problem-solving, showing good emotional perception, empathy, and social skills.

options.text: I understand the frustration. Maybe we need to reassess our resources and see if we can get additional support.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the frustration and suggested a practical step to reassess resources, demonstrating good self-regulation and motivation.

options.text: We’ve been through worse, and we came out stronger. Let’s tackle this head-on and show what we’re capable of.
options.analysis: You focused on motivating the team with a rallying call, showing high motivation but lower empathy and emotional perception.
